other_tests.findings: Normal appearance of liver, gallbladder, spleen, adrenal glands, and pancreas. Mild dependent atelectasis noted at the lung bases. Colonic diverticulosis present without evidence of acute diverticulitis.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Tiny renal hypodensities appear similar to those on prior study, though are too small to accurately characterize.

other_tests.findings: Initial vital signs recorded were: 97.8°F, 71 bpm, 114/56 mmHg, 16 respirations, 97% oxygen saturation. Second set recorded were: 98.3°F, 111/50 mmHg, 75 bpm, 20 respirations, 97% oxygen saturation.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Blood pressure showed a decline; first BP was 114/56 mmHg and dropped to 111/50 mmHg.
